metadata.title: Rava Undrallu | రవ్వ ఉండ్రాళ్ళు | Vinayaka Chavithi Prasadam | Ganesh Chaturthi Recipes | Kudumulu
metadata.description: A full recipe for Rava Undrallu, a special dish for the Vinayaka Chavithi festival. Also known as Uppu Undrallu, this is a simple and tasty prasad that is loved by both adults and children.

transcription_english: [00:00:158] Hello Foodies, welcome to Vismai Food.
[00:02:468] Today's special is Vinayaka Chavithi special Rava Undrallu.
[00:05:438] There are many varieties of undrallu and kudumulu.
[00:08:418] This is one of them.
[00:09:478] Some also call this Uppu Undrallu (Salt Undrallu).
[00:11:978] It's a delicious prasad that can be made very easily.
[00:14:738] Not just Lord Ganesha, even kids will love these undrallu.
[00:18:618] Also, the day before the festival, I will post a video with tips on how to easily and quickly make many prasads in less time and how to plan for it.
[00:27:898] Be sure to watch that video and enjoy the festival happily.
[00:31:698] Now, let's see the recipe.
[00:32:828] First, in a pan, add one cup of rice ravva and roast it on low flame, stirring continuously, until it turns a light golden color.
[00:39:278] Rice ravva is available ready-made.
[00:40:658] If not, you can soak rice overnight, drain and air-dry it the next morning, and once dry, grind it into a coarse powder in a mixer to get rice ravva.
[00:47:118] When it's well-roasted, it will give off a nice aroma.
[00:48:988] At that stage, take it off the heat and keep it aside.
[00:50:888] Now, for one cup of ravva, add three cups of water, one tablespoon of chana dal, one teaspoon of cumin, and one teaspoon of ghee, and bring the water to a rolling boil.
[01:03:708] When the water is boiling, add salt to taste, mix well, then add the roasted rice ravva, mix well, cover, and let the ravva cook on low flame until it becomes soft.
[01:15:378] Remember that if you don't use a thick-bottomed pan, it might stick to the bottom.
[01:20:418] Once the ravva is cooked, turn off the flame and mix well.
[01:24:978] After that, press the ravva together to form a lump, cover it, and leave it for 15 minutes.
[01:30:578] This will allow the ravva to steam internally, making the undrallu very soft and spongy.
[01:34:838] After 15 minutes, the ravva will still be lukewarm.
[01:37:628] At this stage, add one tablespoon of ghee and knead the ravva mixture firmly.
[01:43:288] Then, grease your hands with ghee and shape them into undrallu (balls).
[01:46:488] Traditionally, things like chopped ginger, curry leaves, or green chilies are not added to this prasad.
[01:50:548] This prasad is just this.
[01:51:508] It tastes very delicious.
[01:52:438] Kids will also like it a lot.
[01:54:838] Did you like it?
[01:55:628] Then you try it and be sure to post a picture of how it turned out on the Vismai Food Instagram.
[02:00:438] Enjoy this festive occasion happily.
